Reviews.Title: “Hotel Reding”
Reviews.Author: Chewbutters
Reviews.Content: We were introduced to this boutique hotel through the Rick Steves travel book on Spain. It is centrally located, just off the Plaza Catalunya in Barcelona, inside the old walled area. The hotel has 44 rooms, quite modern, and a wonderful staff to help with everything one might need. Plus, there is the associated restaurant (breakfast is very nice, and included with your room). We stayed four nights, and were very happy with the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Location is almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Miss_manou
Reviews.Content: Its a smal hotel with an almost perfect location, its almost in the middle of the city centre perfect for a weekend when you know you won't be in your hotel other then just sleeping. Breakfast is very simple but ok, go to starbucks around the corner for coffee though! The beds are ok, bathroom simple but clean. there is free wifi thats a big plus!

Reviews.Title: “posizione ottima”
Reviews.Author: PrincipeRoma
Reviews.Content: first of all Barcellona is a fantastic city! we were a party of 8 persons. perfect positions, close to Catalunya square, the ramblas and subway stop. rooms were clean, big enough. the woman receptionist was very helpfull. the cuban lady at the bar was very funny and kind. we had an extra bed (for the third person) not very comfortable. the staff have arranged for us an early (4:30 am) and not expensive transfer to go the airport. if you leave later there is bus from Catalunya square to the main airport (5,50 euros per person) good value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable hotel near the Ramblas...but without the noise!”
Reviews.Author: mosiniak
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a few nights in February 2012. The Reding Hotel is located near the University and the top of the Ramblas that starts at Placa Catalunya. The location is perfect for walking to many of the sites, catching one of the city tour buses or catching the metro. It is close, but not so close that the street noise will keep you up at night. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. They had a "typical" European double bed which is actually two twin beds pushed next to one another... I did not eat at the hotel restaurant, so cannot comment on the quality of food, service, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location”
Reviews.Author: PhilbeachTraveller
Reviews.Content: Booked this with Air Miles as it had an offer of 3 nights for the price of 2. Easy to get to from the Aerobus (literally 2 minutes walk). There is a small reception (no lobby, which would have been nice) and the breakfast room/restaurant is in the basement. There is a small cafe/bar attached to the hotel and you can charge things to your room. It was never very busy, but it may have been a bit more lively later in the evening (not open on Sundays). Our room was on the 3rd floor, at the front and was absolutely fine. Clean, modern-ish and big enough for two, with a small desk, flat screen telly, double bed (two singles pushed together). Also a minibar, and although they didn't publicise the prices, we had some of the water and it wasn't horribly expensive. There is free wifi (although a bit of a weak signal in our room) and satellite telly, although we could only get 3 English language channels- all of them news. The bathroom was spotless, with a good shower (and bath) and some nice toiletries. I concur with other reviewers that it can be noisy. People out in the corridor sounded like they were in our bathroom. Also could hear people stomping around above. Luckily we had an elderly couple next door so no noise from them. Although our room faced the street, it wasn't that bad - from past visits to Spain I was aware of the late night rubbish collection so as long as we opened the windows after 11 pm, we were fine. Saturday night was a definite window-closed night though - people yelling, fighting etc. There is air conditioning in the room. Breakfast was a buffet of hot and cold food, with some Spanish specialities. Great opening hours - breakfast served until 11! The only let down was the coffee machine - you had to take your cup up to the machine and get splattered by the coffee dispenser and then carefully get back to your table without spillage. Otherwise, plenty of fresh food and nice decor. Good location for waking around Barcelona and there is a Metro station nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base camp for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Jussi H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very central location, without being on a very busy and noisy street. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. Everyone we dealt with at the reception spoke english. The beds were not the most comfortable ones I've ever slept in, but not bad either. The walls are a bit thin and you can hear some noises from other rooms, especially the showers, but it wasn't too bad, I slept ok. The hotel was quite cheap, but Breakfast was not included in the room price. We tried it on our last day and it was definitely worth the extra 15e.

Reviews.Title: “1 of the better ones”
Reviews.Author: MalcKentEngland
Reviews.Content: Checking in was very fast, staff very helpful. The hotel is ideally located for the tourist bus which is just up the road. The underground railway has a station just around the corner. We had a twin room which was spotless the beds were very comfortable. The room had aircon or heating depending what you set it on. It had tea or coffee making facilites. All the toiletries that you would need, refreshed every day. The breakfast's were superb most of what people liked, eggs, bacon various sausages, mushrooms, tomatoes,cheeses, fruit, cerals, you would be very fussy if you could not find something you liked. The bar of the hotel had a good selection of drinks and snacks. We did not try the resturant in the evening, as the Sunday evening we were going to try it,it was shut. We did find a very good resturant just around the corner from the hotel called Tallers76, out of the hotel turn right next right and it is on the right about 60 mtrs up, very good food reasonably price, staff there will look after you well, we eat there 4 times and each time the service and food you could not fault. A good tip is catch the A1 bus (about 10 euros return) from the airport and it sets you down at the square about 100mtrs from the hotel. They run every 10 mins or less, well signposted at the airport. A must see is the fountain display at he Place Espana were the Catalana museums are,it runs from about 19.00hrs for 2 hrs roughly, Metro from the hotel about 4 stops down.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but don't get an adjoining room”
Reviews.Author: sanpanchocasa
Reviews.Content: I requested a room with a balcony. I was very happy to arrive and actually have gotten one. I don't know if all the balcony rooms are adjoining ones - but definitely request one that is not. The door between the two rooms must have been very thin, plus there was a gap at the bottom where it should have met the floor. The effect of this was that we heard every footstep (creaky floor) every suitcase zipper, conversations, and all else, as if they were in the same room as we were. In fact the first night that room next door was occupied I was awoken by a sound (their door closing) and then I heard footsteps. I got out of bed to see if someone had entered my room - it sounded so nearby. Then I realized it was the people next door! Too bad because i loved the location, close to the Las Ramblas but on a quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice, modern and well-located”
Reviews.Author: Natasha_R_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with my sister for one night in May and the hotel was perfect for our purposes. Staff was nice and helpful. Everything within easy walking distance: shops and restaurants. just what we needed before leaving Catalonia. The receptionist arranged a very early taxi for us for the airport and the driver was in time. So, all went as planned and the hotel in general left a very good impression.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable place to stay, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Philby_UK
Reviews.Content: In a side street some 10 minutes walk from Catalunya Place this hotel is very convenient for a stay in Barcelona. Staff are courteous, multilingual and helpful. Rooms are fair size for a 3 star hotel and recently decorated. The one we stayed in (504) was equipped with all the usual amenities including a rather weak aircon) and comfortable beds. Breakfast was plentiful and with a wide range of food, based on a European continental style (i.e: no waffles....). There's also a pleasant cafe/bar in the hotel. Central Barcelona tends to be noisy but as the hotel is on a side street it's not too bad. If you ask for an inside room they tend to be quieter anyway. Lots of bars and cafe within a very short walking (staggering?) distance Good place to stay, helpful staff, good breakfast, good location, good price.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Anna601
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of days with my family (incl. 5 years old kids) in this place. It is located quite nice, relatively short (15 min) way from Rambla and Cataunya Place. Breakfast are not vey big but good enough to find something to eat for everybody, including kids, rooms are not very big but good enough to spend the night. Service is a very strong point of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, good location, and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: GrkChk
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with this hotel. This was my second visit to Barcelona and wanted to stay in the catalunya/universidad area, as it was familiar, convenient, and just steps away from everything. The metro was literally steps away, catalunya, ramblas and gracia was a short walk for a nice stroll in the evenings. The automatic doors were manipulated by desk staff, so I felt secure. The staff was helpful. It was clean and modern, rooms of adequate size. Good showers.

Reviews.Title: “excellent small convenient and well kept hotel”
Reviews.Author: tammy018
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days, and had a good time. the location is excellent, the room was quiet and clean. did not try their breakfast. the staff was attentive and helpful. enjoyed the free wi fi connection in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Jeffskins
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the location is excellent but if you like to sleep when you go to bed at night this hotel is not for you. The walls are paper thin. You can hear everything that happens next door, from a simple conversation to the tv or radio all night long. If people next door party all night you wont be sleeping at all. The staff, some were helpful some were not. We stayed in room 509 and 208 and the rooms are not that comfortable, they are VERY small. For less than we paid at this hotel we stayed at much better hotels in Madrid and Toledo. In my opinion location was good but not worth the money. Internet is free but good luck getting a signal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,would definitely stay again,very clean and well equiped”
Reviews.Author: 63Smiler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through airmiles. I had a concern about comments on trip advisor about noise and the bed being hard. We stayed for 4 nights from 18th - 21st May. The hotel was really easy to get to from the airport, the aerobus outside the airport takes you outside the university and its a 10minute walk from there. We stayed in a room on the 5th floor 504, nice room fine for our length of stay,well equipped. There was some noise on some nights but nothing that kept us awake - you can't expect to stay somewhere central and want countryside peace. The only downside was that the breakfast room was small and a few times we had to squeeze past people to get to tables, but the buffet breakfast was really filling we loaded up in the morning then skipped lunch and ate out in the evening. The location is FANTASTIC central to all major attractions. The sausage bar at the end of the street is good value for money. Barcelona generally expensive. Watch that you don't get ripped off at the small bar in the Boqueria market 5.50 eur for a pint. Found a nice bar SHILLING BAR in the Gothic quarter( round the corner from burger king ithink!) 3.5 eur for a large ( a small beer is 3 eur). Monseraat day trip is a must fabulous views. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona treasure”
Reviews.Author: NanaLindaIndy
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights at the Hotel Reding in Barcelona. A great place, and exceptional value. We were 1/2block from Plaza Universtat and the metro, and 3 blocks from the Ramblas and Catalunya metro, and GOOD shopping. Plus starbucks every 3 or 4 blocks. The staff is excellent and knowledgable, and the hotel is clean, comfortable and New York spacious. Can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but avoid the first floor rooms”
Reviews.Author: fleur1104
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location about 5 minutes walk from Placa Catulunya and the top of the Ramblas. We felt very safe in the surrounding areas and the airport bus also stops very close-by on the way from the airport to the city centre (not the other way round - you have to walk to P Catalunya to catch it). The room was a decent size and fairly clean. Our only problem was the noise, we were in room 101 right above reception. There was constant noise during the night as guests need to ring a bell to gain entry to the front door and then it seems have a long, loud chat with the receptionist. I would stay here again, but definitely specifiy a room on the upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: shamc21
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be well located for the main attractions and travel routes. Staff and rooms were pleasant, Breakfast was of a good quality and plenty to choose from. Only downside was some of the rooms are close to reception and the noise from the street.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice in Barcellona”
Reviews.Author: Sofonisba23
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a good area, next to the Ramblas but far from the noise, near to the metro. The room was nice (even if much smaller that it seems on the pictures), we got it at a really good price breakfast included. The staff was really kind and the cleaning good. It's a good choice if you search something not too expensive but good and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient, and good value.”
Reviews.Author: kaydc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in easy walking distance of the sites in the center of the city and we even walked to the Gaudi sites, which are some distance away. The room was very comfortable and the bathroom was large and well equipped. Free computers were available for internet and there were English-language channels on the television. The staff members were terrific, friendly and helpful. We didn't have breakfast there because it was expensive, but there were lots of places in the area. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: travelluver222
Reviews.Content: My husband, two teenagers, and I stayed in two rooms for three nights at Christmas. The rooms were clean, staff was very responsive and all spoke fluent English. Our rooms were ready when we arrived at 10am after an overnight flight so we appreciated being able to check in early. The pictures on the hotel's website are accurate--the rooms are starkly furnished, but room sizes are ample. Very nice beds: firm and comfortable; we faced the back, so it was very quiet; the front faces a small side street which I think would have been quiet as well. Within the hotel, the walls are pretty thin--that bothered my husband who has better hearing than I do. We enjoyed having the two free computers for guest use; hotel has free wifi as well. The breakfast was very good--eggs, bacon, pastries, cold cuts, juices, cappucino machine; for 9.50 Euros pp include in room price, I thought it was worth it to have in the hotel; for the non-included price of 14 Euros, I probably would have gone elsewhere. Location is excellent--2 minute walk to Universitat metro stop, 5 minute walk to Placa Catalyuna metro and square and top of the Ramblas. We would gladly stay here again, with one minor caveat--the hotel has cheap chapstick-shaped soap, so bring a bar of your own. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Waddlerstrikesback
Reviews.Content: Rooms are adequate and clean. There are 2 English channells on the T.V. Breakfast is priced at €14 which we did not avail of, as this is expensive and there are many places in the immediate vicinity. Noise from other rooms is a feature and mini bar prices are excessice (crisps are also charged). Staff are helpful and location is perfect. Bar is not inviting. At €80 a double it is not too dear but neither is it a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: ammammma
Reviews.Content: My husbend and i stay at the hotel for5 days. they welcome us with a smile gave us to choose from 2 roomes they had avallible. The roome was very clean and nice. there wasnt any view from the window becouse we staid at the back of the hotlel. We could walk olmost any were by foot but olso the metro was near and the buses olso and even the airport bus was very near.Good breakfest very teasty. I had birhday and A champagne was waiting for me at the room a nice touch. Veary good hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: snoozedoctor
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights. The room was small but neatly appointed. The mattress was too firm, but rather that than too soft. The rooms are poorly sound-insulated, but I've found that true of many hotels in Europe. The breakfast was good, if a little over-priced. The hotel is in a great location!! Very convenient to the Ramblas, but on a side-street, so it's not too loud at night.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Kristabella_81
Reviews.Content: myself and my husband spent a week in barcelona, at reding hotel, in july 2010, and we fell in love with this city. definitely would come back again. The reding hotel was a plus to make our trip unforgetable. PROS: location (on a quiet street, 3 min on foot to Placa Catalunya & Rambla, 2 min on foot to Placa Universitat-nearest stop for Aerobus, coming from the airport), cleanliness, helpful staff, incredible breakfast (they have it all, including eggs, traditional spanish products, fruits, cookies, cereals, very good orange juice), nice rooms (we did not have any trouble with the noise, all the amenities). CONS: none :) out trip being too short... We would recommend reding hotel to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Very professional. Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: MikefromSeattle
Reviews.Content: Recently completed a six night stay. This hotel is close to Las Ramblas - 3-4 block walk - without being in the midst of the intensity of the Las Ramblas "scene." Metro stop less than a block away. Very helpful and courteous staff. All spoke English well. Breakfast was substantial and tasty. Check for Internet specials.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: historian90
Reviews.Content: A four night stay to celebrate Golden Anniversary. Small hotel, clean and comfortable medium size rooms. Helpful staff specially at reception. Did not find hotel at all noisy. Ideally located in quiet street very close to Las Ramblas and Placa Catalyuna. Metro stations close. Easy walking distance of Gothic Quarter. Very good breakfast cafe and coffee bar but no full restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: raj_arian52
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. We found this hotel very near to the city centre like La Rambla and easy reach to nearest metro stop Universitat. We booked double bed room but was given two single bed. But when we complained about it the staff was ready to change our room. Staffs are very helpful. The most good thing about this hotel is location and the breakfast. There were lot of variety in breakfast e.g. variety in sausages, bread selections, fruits and many more and more. Me and my partner enjoyed our breakfast every day. The room was clean, but the toilet is not that long as it looks like in the photo but it is ok. I would definitely recommend this hotel for the tourists who want a cheap but good hotel and want to stay near city centre. I would love to stay here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: merryFlorida
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, and convenient location -Did not find it noisey as other reviewers did and we were there on a weekend at the end of the Merce festival.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but okay”
Reviews.Author: Vokoban
Reviews.Content: People are not kidding about the noise in this hotel. We stayed here for 6 nights and it was difficult to sleep. I am not a light sleeper and I live in New York City across the street from a 24/7 diner so I think I'm a pretty good judge of what constitutes as too much noise. My boyfriend and I were woken up several times a night every night. There is a skate park nearby that has people screaming into megaphones until around 4am. In addition to this, if someone so much as tiptoes in the hallway, you WILL hear it. The walls are PAPER THIN. I could hear people's conversation LOUD AND CLEAR from the bedroom next door -- I took to whispering a lot so as to avoid people listening in on my conversations. I was woken up every morning by someone walking down the hall. It was very very disturbing to me. Ridiculous noise levels aside, the hotel is superb. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and modern, the staff is friendly and speaks great english, the location is really incredible (2 blocks from Las Ramblas!!). These things really can compensate for some of the lost sleep time. If you are going to sightsee like I was, then you should request a room that doesn't face the street to avoid SOME of the noise and possibly bring some ear plugs just in case. It really is a great hotel and everything is so close by and accessible. Really great neighborhood too. Oh also just to note... free wifi, mini fridge in room, and air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “If you want sleepless nights stay here”
Reviews.Author: PershoreRambler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in this hotel and we managed one decent nights sleep. This was due to the noise coming from both outside and inside. The street was busy most of the night with people coming and going. Also the refuse was collected and the bottle bank emptied in the small hours. Adjacent there seemed to be an all night skate board park. Inside we could here everything that was going on in the adjacent rooms and corridors. We had a second floor room facing the street and had to ask to be moved to the back of the hotel so that we could get some quiet. On the plus side the breakfasts were good with a selection of food. The cafe was reasonable and served some good food. Staff were unenthusiastic and carried out their duties without grace. We felt as though we were just numbers filling the room. The hotel spoilt what would otherwise have been an enjoyable few days in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and very nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: oty01
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel in Barcelona. It is located near the University, and it has access to metro, many buses, and the airport bus too. As it is on a smaller street, there is no noise, compared to other hotels. The room was really big, and the bed huge. I booked directly at the hotel site, and thus I got some welcome champaign! There are facilities to make a tee in the room by yourself, if you don't get the breakfast. I had it included in the price of the room, and it was fain. Nothing fancy, but good quality. If I have another trip to Barcelona, I will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & convenient as well.”
Reviews.Author: Mottram23
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying at this hotel for a 3 night break. Small but really nice hotel which is convenient for Las Ramblas and the city's tour buses. Breakfast was good with a reasonably good choice which was continually restocked. Rooms were of a good size and were clean and soundproofed internally. The bed linen was changed daily. Only slight downside was that we were facing the street and the double glazing did not keep out the noise, particularly the night Barcelona won the Spanish cup! Staff were nice and friendly and I would certainly use this hotel again if I visited Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Reding”
Reviews.Author: yetiScotland
Reviews.Content: We spent ten days at the Reding to celebrate my 70th birthday.We had a wonderful time .The hotel was super clean, breakfast amazing.The staff were very friendly , one or two an absolute joy , with such enthusiasm for what we planned to do with our days . They all spoke good English, much better than my feeble attempt at a few words of Catalan.Suggestions from them for our trips resulted in a visit to Palau de la Musica Catalana which is a must for anyone visiting the city but had not been on out list . Also a day on the train to take the trip to Montserrat and the monastery . What a scary cable car ride but well worth it and some brilliant photographs from the top . Our first day coincided with the local festival and in the evening we joined in the parada around the streets . We never felt threatened on our walks around the city and saw no evidence of the pick pockets we were warned about but then we were very careful. We found some great eating places , Tapas Gaudi being the one we went back to . We enjoyed our evening wanders down Las Ramblas to Port Vell and on our last night we sat and watched the world go by while drinking our huge glass of Sangria. In fact the whole holiday was everything we could have wished for .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SpaintravelerNewYork
Reviews.Content: We started our two week Spain vacation in Barcelona at Hotel Reding. Nice clean rooms and friendly front desk staff that spoke very good english. We arrived at 11am and we were able to get our room right away, which was great since we just got off an overnight flight. The location was fantastic, easy walking distance to Las Ramblas and many great areas. Also one block from the metro station Universitat. We were able to get everywhere we wanted very easity via the metro. Nice cafe for quick coffee and crossiant in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “very central location”
Reviews.Author: STEVEFR
Reviews.Content: The Hotel can be accessed from airport by 25 min train ride. Station is Passeig De Gracia. One stop after Barcelona Sants, then a 10 min walk to Hotel. There are many exits from the station so this can be confusing. A better option may be the Airbus that stops at Plaza Universitat which is just 2 mins from Hotel and will take around 35 mins. The hotel has a secure door for entry so you need to buzz in for added security. What I did not like about the hotel was safety deposit box was extra at eur4.50 per day. I normally expect this to be free in rooms, but perhaps is the norm in Spain. There also seemed to be some noise comming from other rooms so I presume the walls are not to sound proofed but not excessive. The front desk was very friendly & efficiant and very good english spoken. The rooms were clean and not to small. Bathroom bright and large. View from front windows look straight into appartmnets accross small road so not to private with curtains open. Double bed was 2 singles pushed together though may not be in all rooms. The breakfast buffett is very good and well stocked with continental and hot choices, sweets etc. Very impressed. Also the Filipino lady working in the breakfast area was just so friendly. Many bars and restaurants near by. Las Ramblas is a few mins walk as is Pl Catalunya and adjacents shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “An Exellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CasalRio
Reviews.Content: Good location, good acomodation, very helpfull staff...An exellent hotel

Reviews.Title: “Modest and nice”
Reviews.Author: JuniperFinland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for four nights in March 2008. The hotel was nice and modest. The staff, especially the ladies, spoke good English. We chose to book the room with breakfast was included and that was a good choice, breakfast was good with jamon serrano and delicious juices and... Yummy. The hotel is located on a small street with some bars, restaurants and tapas places near-by. The location is great, the hotel is within a walking distance to La Ramblas, Placa de Catalunya, the El Corte Ingles department store and two subway stations. Our room was on the top floor (fifth floor) and we heard some occasional noise from outside and the other rooms but most of the time it was quiet. The room was OK. I read from an earlier review that the beds are really firm and that was true! They were a bit too firm for me but if you like firm beds then it's no problem. We booked a non-smoking room but there was an ashtray in the room and a strong deodoriser smell when we arrived, but no cigarrette smell. There was plenty of cupboard space and the bathroom was nice and spacious. However, you had to pay extra if you wanted to use the safe. I would say that this hotel is a good, decent place for staying. Nothing remarkably special, nothing remarkably terrible. Nice and modest.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, nice and central”
Reviews.Author: MuzDog
Reviews.Content: A lovely clean hotel, located less than five mins walk from the main street of the city, La Rambla, and a couple of minutes from the Universitat underground station for easy access around the stunning city. The stylish rooms are smallish but not cramped, fitted with tea-making facilities and a widescreen telly. Plenty of cupboard and wardrobe space as well. Nice, bright clean en suite bathroom with bidet. The bath, fitted with shower, is quite small though. Chambermaid services were excellent. Staff on reception all spoke good English and were helpful, while the buffet breakfast was good. The woman who looked after the breakfast room made sure your day started with a warm smile. There was a nice selection of fruit juices, cereals, pastries plus about eight hot items from scrambled egg to bacon, mushrooms and sausages. All very tasty, although the coffee was not quite to my liking! Eating out prices are about on a par with the UK, but be warned the bars on the main streets can be quite pricey. We stayed in the city for four nights, but there was not enough time. Seems to be something for everyone from beach-goers to football fans to culture vultures. Even the less culturally minded will be amazed by all the Gaudi architecture. A super city and a fantastic hotel to see it all.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: annejim
Reviews.Content: Central but quiet location. We had a 1st floor room at the back and could hear no noise at all. The room was a little on the small size and rather plain & clinical, but it was spotlessly clean, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom spacious with a bath as well as shower (though it had irritatingly noisy sliding doors). Breakfasts quite good (if a bit expensive - 12 euros). There is a good-sized comfortable lounge on the 1st floor. Staff spoke good English and were helpful. We didn't have dinner in the hotel but on two occasions used the Gravina across the road. The restaurant here opens at 7.30pm (most restaurants don't open till 8.30pm or 9pm). The service is courteous and the fish excellent, while the price is very reasonable with water and appetizers free. In eating places, don't place a coat containing a wallet over the back of a chair. We did this once, and the wallet was pinched even though the pocket was zipped up. Although it was late November, the weather was quite mild & sunny.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Reding Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: AngelaMillom
Reviews.Content: The location and price were excellent. Being just off a main street near Plaza Cataluña allowed for the convenience of getting around yet didn'y bring with it the traffic noise. Friendly staff and worked effectivly.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely Reding”
Reviews.Author: bhartley
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a quiet hotel which was centrally located Pleased to report in our experience that the hotel was,although right in centre,was reasonably quiet. The staff were very helpful and pleasant and the hotel was very bright and clean. Breakfast facility was excellent with plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Mixed Blessings at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hardworker
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival greeted by haughty and monosyllabic staff who explained absolutely nothing about the hotel's facilities and offered not a word of welcome nor volunteered help with baggage. Very few smiles here. The public rooms are very cramped especially the dining room in the basement. I didn't even realise that there was a lounge on the first floor. I am a single traveller and after my experience at check in was half expecting a tiny cell like room however I have to say I had a decent sized twin room which (apart from dirty curtains and nets which stank of nicotine) was clean with good bathroom. The bed however was extremely hard and uncomfortable. I had paid a hefty single supplement for the pleasure! The only good things I have to say is that the breakfasts were very good with a wide choice of well presented food and there was also a very pleasant lady in charge of serving breakfasts which I have to say made all the difference. The hotel is in a good central location however I do wish I had chosen one of the other many hotels available Barcelona and will not return to the Reding.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good!”
Reviews.Author: AmberinSeattle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and the staff is nice, that's the only positive components. When we arrived in our room the bathroom was locked, so the maid came in & spent 30 minutes trying to pick the lock. We only recieved 2 towels everyday of our trip. You can't keep your curtains open if you don't want people leering in your room, it's right across from the H10 Gravina Hotel (which is MUCH nicer, we stayed there last time). The room itself was small & only 2 twin beds were avaiable, they DID NOT join together well! The decor is old & run down. And the walls are thin, we constantly heard people in the hallway and street traffic kept us up at night. Also, my husband & his co-worker were there for a conference and only recieved 1 of 3 wake up calls (the one that was made came 30 minutes late). This resulted in them being late on a day they were supposed to speak, very bad situation! I do not reccomend this hotel, unless there is no other option! This was kind of the case for us since all the hotels were full during the week we came. We (myself & co-workers wife) finally stopped tipping the maid - it just didn't seem to make a difference. This is probably the worst hotel I have ever stayed at, certainly the worst in Europe-and it wasn't the cheapest. Amber Seattle, WA

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: vickijj
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the Reding Hotel with a friend. We found the accommodation excellent value for money, the room was spotlessly clean, the Reception staff were friendly and helpful. When we reported that our shower head had fallen off, we found that it had been replaced inside one hour of reporting it ! The location is very good, being within 5/10 mins walk of Place Catalunya where the Airport bus stops and the Tourist bus originates. We were lucky to have breakfast included and again cannot fault the selection available. Yes, the street is noisy, but i have found this is par for the course with many City hotels in several different countries. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a value short break in Barcelona.

HotelInfo.Name: Reding Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Gravina, 5 - 7, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
